concise_definition: n. 粪肥, 污垢, 垃圾; v. 搞脏, 搅动粪肥

definitions.explanation_en: Dung or decaying organic matter used as fertilizer, especially in agricultural contexts; also refers to dirty, messy, or filthy material.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用作肥料的动物粪便或腐烂的有机物质，尤用于农业语境；也可泛指肮脏、杂乱或污秽的物质。
definitions.example_en: The farmer spread muck over the fields to enrich the soil.
definitions.example_cn: 农夫把粪肥撒在田里以肥沃土壤。

definitions.explanation_en: A general term for dirt, grime, or rubbish, often implying something unpleasant or messy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 泛指污垢、污渍或垃圾，常带有令人不快或杂乱的含义。
definitions.example_en: After the storm, the streets were covered in muck and debris.
definitions.example_cn: 风暴过后，街道上覆盖着污垢和瓦砾。

definitions.explanation_en: To work with or spread muck, especially manure, typically in farming or gardening.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指从事与粪肥相关的工作，如翻动或施撒粪肥，多用于农业或园艺场景。
definitions.example_en: He spent the morning mucking out the stables.
definitions.example_cn: 他一上午都在清理马厩。

definitions.explanation_en: To make something dirty or messy, often by handling or coming into contact with filth.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过接触污物使某物变脏或凌乱。
definitions.example_en: The kids mucked up their clothes playing in the mud.
definitions.example_cn: 孩子们在泥地里玩耍，把衣服弄脏了。

comparison.analysis: “Dirt” (污垢) 是更通用的词，泛指任何不干净的物质，如灰尘、泥土，通常不带有肥料或有机腐烂的含义。而 “muck” 更具体，常指潮湿、有臭味的有机污物，如粪肥或烂泥，语义更重、更粗俗。
“Garbage” (垃圾) 指人类丢弃的废弃物，如食物残渣、包装等，通常是无机或非生物降解的。而 “muck” 更偏向自然产生的有机污物，如动物粪便或腐烂植物，语义更偏向农业或自然环境。
“Sludge” (污泥) 指工业或污水处理中产生的粘稠、半固体废物，常含化学成分，语义更技术化、更现代。而 “muck” 是口语化、更原始的词，多用于农场或户外脏乱场景，不具专业性。
